description:
cmd: Minor changes in command documentation to have the same style in the
format the way it is presented so it keeps uniform style.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

I am not sure all these line breaks are necessary.
Leaving for Rob.
with the exception of the table formatting for pack, none of these changes seem worthwhile or even an improvement.

Yes, I know the other changes related to the new paragraphs at the start
where there's a link to external documentation are not worthwhile.

I think cgo, cov, go, pack itself, prof and yacc changes related to usage
to make table formatting are worth too, don't you?

(Sorry for the rest of changes, I was doing parsing on that documentation
to make automatic man pages generation and though documents would read
better).

Will update now the changes leaving only the ones I think are important and
leave the decision up to you. If not review it and I will leave only the
changes on pack.

Thanks

On Tue, Feb 28, 2012 at 01:13, <r@golang.org> wrote:

> with the exception of the table formatting for pack, none of these
> changes seem worthwhile or even an improvement.
>
> http://codereview.appspot.com/**5695074/<http://codereview.appspot.com/5695074/>
>

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, rsc@golang.org, r@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

Let's just leave this alone.  The changes to pack are pretty but wrong:
pack does not take - flags.

subject: code review 5695074: cmd: Minor changes in command documentation to have the...
